clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Metformin on Glycemic Control and Insulin Sensitivity in Adolescents With T1DM
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Metformin on Glycemic Control and Insulin Sensitivity in Adolescents With T1DM: A Randomized, Cross-over, Prospective Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Third Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: Third Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators intends to carry out a randomized, cross-over, prospective study which will last 48 weeks in youth with T1DM followed up by the center. The purpose is to observe the effects of metformin on glycemic control and insulin sensitivity in adolescents with T1DM based on insulin therapy by using 72h CGMS and hyperinsulinemic euglycemic clamps.

arm_group.description: MDI or CSII plus metformin (initially starting dosage with 0.5g qd, then gradually increasing to 0.5g bid or tid) for 24 weeks

intervention.description: For arm 1, accept MDI or CSII plus metformin (initially starting dosage with 0.5g qd, then gradually increasing to 0.5g tid) for 24 weeks.
For arm 2, just accept insulin for 24 weeks
